commit_message:
Fix missing neutron net plugin options

They are missing from the sample config produced by
oslo-config-generator due to omissions in manila/opts.py.

Add them.

Closes-Bug: #1728463

Change-Id: Ibc473af77fde48e3a5e761e0b959d145acd7fbf9
(cherry picked from commit 2a8cd75583d06ce5be665f8fba03d5cb4a8ebcb4)

Switch scenario004-containers to use ceph-ansible

scenario004.

subject: Fix icons alignment in IE11/Edge browsers
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-20 16:00:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix icons alignment in IE11/Edge browsers

text-anchor and dominant-baseline properties are calculated
in an other way in MS browsers. That's why we have to use
X and Y properties for text in icons in SVG.

Closes-Bug: #1716879
Change-Id: Ic639e7376a755198d264d0dd6d1d9edd156ddae6
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-09 08:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/js/horizon.networktopology.js', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tabs.js'], 'message': "Fix icons alignment in IE11/Edge browsers

text-anchor and dominant-baseline properties are calculated
in an other way in MS browsers. That's why we have to use
X and Y properties for text in icons in SVG.

Closes-Bug: #1716879
Change-Id: Ic639e7376a755198d264d0dd6d1d9edd156ddae6
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix icons alignment in IE11/Edge browsers

text-anchor and dominant-baseline properties are calculated
in an other way in MS browsers. That's why we have to use
X and Y properties for text in icons in SVG.

Closes-Bug: #1716879
Change-Id: Ic639e7376a755198d264d0dd6d1d9edd156ddae6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-31 13:27:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve node count indicator in roles step

Instead of only saying how many nodes are available for assignment, we now also
say how many require further action, and how many have already been assigned.
We also indicate how many nodes are in the system altogether.

Change-Id: I061277672a21e382676043245af60882127133f7
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-31 17:06:48.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/components/deployment_plan/CurrentPlan.js', 'src/js/components/deployment_plan/RolesStep.js'], 'message': 'Improve node count indicator in roles step

Instead of only saying how many nodes are available for assignment, we now also
say how many require further action, and how many have already been assigned.
We also indicate how many nodes are in the system altogether.

Change-Id: I061277672a21e382676043245af60882127133f7
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Improve node count indicator in roles step

Instead of only saying how many nodes are available for assignment, we now also
say how many require further action, and how many have already been assigned.
We also indicate how many nodes are in the system altogether.

Change-Id: I061277672a21e382676043245af60882127133f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-19 19:06:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Set DLRN hash when release file contains dlrn_hash variable

When deploying with containerized overcloud and updating
containers prior to deploy, the DLRN hash of the images
used to install should match that of the containers' tags.

This review adds steps to get the DLRN hash and set the
repos baseurl. The containers tags will be redefined per
the dlrn_hash variable set.

Change-Id: Ib4f28dfe16e728ff015de11fa59cf21b028b3d34

commit_message:
Set DLRN hash when release file contains dlrn_hash variable

When deploying with containerized overcloud and updating
containers prior to deploy, the DLRN hash of the images
used to install should match that of the containers' tags.

This review adds steps to get the DLRN hash and set the
repos baseurl. The containers tags will be redefined per
the dlrn_hash variable set.

Change-Id: Ib4f28dfe16e728ff015de11fa59cf21b028b3d34

We have to fetch and show Cinder availability zones list during volume

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-03 09:59:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve Volume selection handling in LI

The code for updating the Volume Size error in the Launch Instance
source step appears to be incorrect. This patch updates and improves the
handling to also bump the current value to the minimum for the chosen
image (rather than just a form field error). Also changed the default to
create a new volume, as it was advised that this is the more common
workflow.

Change-Id: Iecb679d967b2285776278f23018e4151ebb18df2
Closes-Bug: 1568866
(cherry picked from commit 3e65e337ee5c707a6f27a7f406d76dab751cb8b2)

The code for updating the Volume Size error in the Launch Instance
source step appears to be incorrect. This patch updates and improves the
handling to also bump the current value to the minimum for the chosen
image (rather than just a form field error). Also changed the default to

commit_message:
Improve Volume selection handling in LI

The code for updating the Volume Size error in the Launch Instance
source step appears to be incorrect. This patch updates and improves the
handling to also bump the current value to the minimum for the chosen
image (rather than just a form field error). Also changed the default to
create a new volume, as it was advised that this is the more common
workflow.

Change-Id: Iecb679d967b2285776278f23018e4151ebb18df2
Closes-Bug: 1568866
(cherry picked from commit 3e65e337ee5c707a6f27a7f406d76dab751cb8b2)

subject: Used cached git sources and enable depends-on
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-03 18:32:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I88d38d0e6ac7038c672f7bb6a3931c8399f36d8a
Depends-On: I2abda86df19980c963e3cb176db2f877ba9a312b

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I88d38d0e6ac7038c672f7bb6a3931c8399f36d8a
Depends-On: I2abda86df19980c963e3cb176db2f877ba9a312b

[{'created': '2017-10-29 06:37:26.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/legacy-ironic-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I3141f12d0de00c3d8def2862881326f349edd479
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I3141f12d0de00c3d8def2862881326f349edd479

subject: Add charm config option for force_raw_images
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 00:49:13.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/nova_compute_context.py', 'templates/ocata/nova.conf', 'config.yaml', 'unit_tests/test_nova_compute_contexts.py'], 'message': 'Add charm config option for force_raw_images

Since Ocata, backing images are by default converted into raw format

commit_message:
Add charm config option for force_raw_images

Since Ocata, backing images are by default converted into raw format
but since Pike a problem with O_DIRECT calls and ZFS backend storage
has presented - i.e., Pike on LXD with ZFS backend storage will result
in an error about image conversion. This config option allows
that default to be changed so that Pike on LXD with ZFS will lauch
instances succesfully.

Closes-Bug: 1710994

Change-Id: Ieba15b44b4b56a356d58c4504dd259fc80e7575d
(cherry picked from commit a6638ce3bf633e8abc6e52b030d9d1c12338f9b4)

subject: Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 04:10:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/ceph.conf'], 'message': 'Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`

Upstream Ceph removed the `osd crush location` option in
commit f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e [0]. This
causes new clusters deployed from the Pike UCA (Luminous)
using the customize-failure-domain option to not create or
move the OSD to the correct spot in the OSD tree. The end
result is that placement groups will fail to peer because
there are no racks to select hosts and OSDs from.

Instead, the charm should set the more generic `crush
location` option in the ceph.conf file. It is and has been
supported since the Firefly (trusty-icehouse) version of
Ceph.

[0] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e

Change-Id: I0b7055b20f54096a2f33583079326aee17726355
Closes-Bug: 1730839
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`

Upstream Ceph removed the `osd crush location` option in
commit f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e [0]. This
causes new clusters deployed from the Pike UCA (Luminous)
using the customize-failure-domain option to not create or
move the OSD to the correct spot in the OSD tree. The end
result is that placement groups will fail to peer because
there are no racks to select hosts and OSDs from.

Instead, the charm should set the more generic `crush
location` option in the ceph.conf file. It is and has been
supported since the Firefly (trusty-icehouse) version of
Ceph.

[0] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e

Change-Id: I0b7055b20f54096a2f33583079326aee17726355
Closes-Bug: 1730839

commit_message:
Stop child objects changing status when LB locked

This patch corrects a bug in the load balancer locking that would
modify the child object provisioning status even though it is returning
that the load balancer is currently immutable.

Change-Id: I017bdcd902327d0cc363a6edb34c5eaeb9fd42e8
Story: 2001258
Task: 5788

commit_message:
Avoid neutron calls at recovering precreated ports

This patch ensures only 1 get calls is made to neutron to get the
ports when recovering precreated ports upon controller reboot. It
also ensures only one call is made to get the subnet information
per subnet, instead of 1 per port. Further improvements can be
made but this at least reduces the pressure on neutron side.

Partially Implements blueprint ports-pool

Change-Id: I635e7d3ac1a76b014dcfb1ef7539cfd56e73dddd

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_cache_create: Use threads when compressing base image

Use multiple threads when compressing the base container image. The
special value of '0' instructs 'xz' to use as many threads as the number
of CPUs on the system. This change improves the total amount of time it
takes to compress the image up to ~85%

Before:
lxc_hosts : Create lxc image ------------------------------------------- 28.42s

After:
lxc_hosts : Create lxc image -------------------------------------------- 3.98s

Change-Id: I5fa162e027882ada4e45a392ae3757f0658cd599

commit_message:
Pass missing arguments to session in SessionClient._make_session_request

If a server does not return API version headers, this will make the fallback
to /v1 work correctly.

Change-Id: I42b66daea1f4397273a3f4eb1638abafb3bb28ce
Closes-Bug: #1726870

commit_message:
Use resource collectors for ordering in stonith manifests

In change I61f3393b88b65d29e2f2a5fdf6c2e2a112bfc9a1 we switched
to using resource collectors in order to require the wait-for-settle
Exec.

Let's make the same change for stonith resources as well, so we
can avoid the $pcmk_require workaround.

Change-Id: I99c719370bf8a1a8864b7472a3276ecd227df93f

commit_message:
Move legacy ironicclient jobs in-tree

This moves the legacy python-ironicclient CI jobs into the
python-ironicclient tree, instead of storing them in
openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs.

This also changes the ironicclient-tempest-dsvm-src job to
inherit from legacy-ironic-dsvm-base instead of legacy-dsvm-base,
since the required projects are the same.

This will give us control as we migrate the legacy jobs to the
new ansible roles.

Change-Id: If0c072e357fbeccc3dee8cc06b96e1bfa42299a7
(cherry picked from commit 9232ebd6d9dda0f6ddec71fe3353abf9a08f31d0)

subject: Allow multiple stonith declarations in one manifest
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 10:46:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow multiple stonith declarations in one manifest

Creating two stonith resources with the same fence agent within
the same manifest fails like this:

Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Resource Statement,
Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Resource Statement, Duplicate
declaration: Package[fence-agents-amt] is already declared in file
/etc/puppet/modules/pacemaker/manifests/stonith/fence_amt.pp:293; cannot
redeclare at
/etc/puppet/modules/pacemaker/manifests/stonith/fence_amt.pp:293 at
/etc/puppet/modules/pacemaker/manifests/stonith/fence_amt.pp:293:5 at
/root/pacemaker-tests/test.pp:28 on node nuc3.int.rhx

Let's switch to ensure_resource for the package installation statements.
This way we can create multiple statements:
pacemaker::stonith::fence_amt { 'stonith-fence-nuc1':
  ipaddr         => '192.0.3.99',
  passwd         => 'foobar!',
  pcmk_host_list => 'nuc1',
}
pacemaker::stonith::fence_amt { 'stonith-fence-nuc2':
  ipaddr         => '192.0.2.100',
  passwd         => 'foobar!',
  pcmk_host_list => 'nuc2',
}
pacemaker::stonith::fence_amt { 'stonith-fence-nuc3':
  ipaddr         => '192.0.2.101',
  passwd         => 'foobar!',
  pcmk_host_list => 'nuc3',
}

And we correctly get the stonith devices configured:

 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-nuc1	(stonith:fence_amt):	Started nuc2
 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-nuc2	(stonith:fence_amt):	Started nuc1
 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-nuc3	(stonith:fence_amt):	Started nuc1

Change-Id: I1cf5337bfcbe85b3ff66f5102fb4120d19884e41
Closes-Bug: #1717660

commit_message:
Allow multiple stonith declarations in one manifest

Creating two stonith resources with the same fence agent within
the same manifest fails like this:

Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Resource Statement,
Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Resource Statement, Duplicate
declaration: Package[fence-agents-amt] is already declared in file
/etc/puppet/modules/pacemaker/manifests/stonith/fence_amt.pp:293; cannot
redeclare at
/etc/puppet/modules/pacemaker/manifests/stonith/fence_amt.pp:293 at
/etc/puppet/modules/pacemaker/manifests/stonith/fence_amt.pp:293:5 at
/root/pacemaker-tests/test.pp:28 on node nuc3.int.rhx

Let's switch to ensure_resource for the package installation statements.
This way we can create multiple statements:
pacemaker::stonith::fence_amt { 'stonith-fence-nuc1':
  ipaddr         => '192.0.3.99',
  passwd         => 'foobar!',
  pcmk_host_list => 'nuc1',
}
pacemaker::stonith::fence_amt { 'stonith-fence-nuc2':
  ipaddr         => '192.0.2.100',
  passwd         => 'foobar!',
  pcmk_host_list => 'nuc2',
}
pacemaker::stonith::fence_amt { 'stonith-fence-nuc3':
  ipaddr         => '192.0.2.101',
  passwd         => 'foobar!',
  pcmk_host_list => 'nuc3',
}

And we correctly get the stonith devices configured:

 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-nuc1	(stonith:fence_amt):	Started nuc2
 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-nuc2	(stonith:fence_amt):	Started nuc1
 stonith-fence_amt-stonith-fence-nuc3	(stonith:fence_amt):	Started nuc1

Change-Id: I1cf5337bfcbe85b3ff66f5102fb4120d19884e41
Closes-Bug: #1717660
Closes-Bug: #1553227

subject: SUSE: Avoid repositoy refresh and metadata clean up
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 08:10:25.000000000', 'files': ['vars/suse-42.yml'], 'message': "SUSE: Avoid repositoy refresh and metadata clean up

The only reason we do a refresh is to import the GPG keys and also to
ensure that our metadata is update. However, we don't really need to do
that since zypper is smart to check for outdated metadata. We can also
import the keys when we install packages or updating the distro.

Change-Id: I4f53f33dd31184d2e3c70c6ad93cea857b30895a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Avoid repositoy refresh and metadata clean up

The only reason we do a refresh is to import the GPG keys and also to
ensure that our metadata is update. However, we don't really need to do
that since zypper is smart to check for outdated metadata. We can also
import the keys when we install packages or updating the distro.

Change-Id: I4f53f33dd31184d2e3c70c6ad93cea857b30895a

commit_message:
Create devstack plugin for monasca-events

!Parts of code taken from monasca-api and monasca-log-api!

Also create a dummy implementataion for version endpoint
so that the deployment can be tested.

Story: 2001112
Task: 4808

Change-Id: Ic35f6388c34c4d4c1198401a1c6972b802a54c67

commit_message:
Galera: add support for encrypted SST

When internal TLS is enabled, generate a galera config that enable
encryption of SST rsync traffic.

The configuration relies on a new sst script wsrep_sst_rsync_tunnel,
which encapsulates rsync traffic in a socat-based encrypted tunnel.

Change-Id: I1d6ee8febb596b3ab9dcde3a85a028ee99b2798c
Depends-On: Ia857350ac451fc1bda6659d85019962d3a9d5617
Closes-Bug: #1719885

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-27 09:02:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add validation task in docker services [Ceilometer]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

Also, remove 'when' condition to stop and disable the
service as this is an indenpotent operation. This way
we ensure the service is always stopped and disabled.

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Ceilometer]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

Change-Id: I28488b51e6a2e2d0e0ac41d0d7c35be4edb59cbb
Partial-Bug: #1704389
Closes-Bug: #1724478

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I04e0c07976d8f3fc0c77681fae45794cb69af10d
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: Ie035cda96443514fa1f4bf63c153afd82966330a
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: Ibb8f51430a5f44e83897d855afd020a8c24efbe5
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

commit_message:
Add new MySQL server option to mysql_bundle

Add innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit from
Id5a30f1daf978e094a74db2d284febbc9ae64bb3
to the container-specific mysql_bundle.pp

Note that innodb_buffer_pool_size from
Iabdcb6f76510becb98cba35c95db550ffce44ff3 should already
be pulled at runtime from the base mysql.pp.

Closes-Bug: #1730360
Change-Id: Iba164ddcc9b24ee231fb224b03ad8e7c123d5418
(cherry picked from commit 7de6d8d9f5687cdb7e1709a7e15e98184aa615f0)

commit_message:
Rename options to the prepare command for clarity

Changed the following options:
* '--images-file' to '--output-images-file'
* '--env-file' to '--output-env-file'
* '--service-environment-file' to '--environment-file' in order to
  match the equivalent option of the deploy command.

The old options are still in place and show a Deprecation warning in
the help message.

Change-Id: I24a6021d19ffe74760f9897e9bf3453742939bc9
Closes-Bug: #1723157
(cherry picked from commit d2cc4c548978b94ef7a78cd6479d191c38ee1736)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-11 22:29:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support to drive undercloud deploy via undercloud.conf

This lets us use the usual undercloud install command and undercloud.conf
and kick off the undercloud deploy install process using a --experimental
option.

The undercloud.conf parameter are mapped to heat parameter overrides and
generates a undercloud_parameter.yaml, which gets passed to undercloud deploy
command.

WIP: Still some work is left to map other undercloud.conf params

Change-Id: I5cf5798cd084d99a3c892daab6db444d1e608beb
Partially-implements: blueprint heat-undercloud

commit_message:
Support to drive undercloud deploy via undercloud.conf

This lets us use the usual undercloud install and upgrade commands with
undercloud.conf and kick off the undercloud deploy install or upgrade
process using a --use-heat option.

The undercloud.conf parameter are mapped to heat parameter overrides and
generates a undercloud_parameter.yaml, which gets passed to undercloud deploy
command.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Depends-On: I9fce6477566b439ceb2b5dc25eae307af9c9cc2b

Change-Id: I5cf5798cd084d99a3c892daab6db444d1e608beb
Partially-implements: blueprint heat-undercloud

commit_message:
Deprecate --pull-source for container prepare command

The registry should be included in the --namespace argument to be
consistent with the other image references.

Change-Id: I0b0b8728b7752bdd4680a5a2bbf664f94f7d56d9
Closes-Bug: #1708303
Depends-On: I1769c7cf1c058328a8490228bdc4719e8d216ccb
(cherry picked from commit 8c328b659ebf6c328d483b09e5df30cb8955be17)

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I9bab9ec59fa685db3bf693406d5118f9feac7468
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I594b754a3bd915f56cf386b77c1bb0d5f3b6575e
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-25 15:20:41.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/horizon.yaml'], 'message': "Fix /etc/openstack-dashboard/ permissions for access to *policy.json

The Kolla Dockerfile sets the permissions for /etc/openstack-dashboard/
to horizon:horizon. We need this to be readable by the apache user
as the horizon user is not the user in which httpd runs with. We may
want to consider fixing this in the upstream Dockerfile instead, e.g.
checking if we're using centos/rhel and changing the permissions that
way. I'm not sure why it's set to horizon:horizon upstream, and I'm keen
not to break any existing functionality that relies on the horizon based
permissions.

Closes-Bug: #1723125
Change-Id: If5feebae38f7fdfffa60bfaedc4521f676006484
(cherry picked from commit fd657aa4e68de7ad239a88525b5ae343acd3bf80)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix /etc/openstack-dashboard/ permissions for access to *policy.json

The Kolla Dockerfile sets the permissions for /etc/openstack-dashboard/
to horizon:horizon. We need this to be readable by the apache user
as the horizon user is not the user in which httpd runs with. We may
want to consider fixing this in the upstream Dockerfile instead, e.g.
checking if we're using centos/rhel and changing the permissions that
way. I'm not sure why it's set to horizon:horizon upstream, and I'm keen
not to break any existing functionality that relies on the horizon based
permissions.

Closes-Bug: #1723125
Change-Id: If5feebae38f7fdfffa60bfaedc4521f676006484
(cherry picked from commit fd657aa4e68de7ad239a88525b5ae343acd3bf80)

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecated. Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I95c6dd53713fc1d0a287fce9b42afdce1eba198c
(cherry picked from commit 05230cca8cebe9c1d9a9fc9f8f5cf084ef5d8f57)

[{'created': '2017-11-06 16:54:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] ironic upgrade: change ownership for ironic-dbsync.log

Commit bf00e679016b60b421a9af353dd09dcaef514926 broke upgrades of existing
ironic deployments, as it tries running ironic-dbsync from "ironic" user,
while the existing ironic-dbsync.log file is owned by root.

This change adds creating a file resource with the correct ACLs before

commit_message:
ironic upgrade: change ownership for ironic-dbsync.log

Commit bf00e679016b60b421a9af353dd09dcaef514926 broke upgrades of existing
ironic deployments, as it tries running ironic-dbsync from "ironic" user,
while the existing ironic-dbsync.log file is owned by root.

This change adds creating a file resource with the correct ACLs before
running ironic-dbsync.

Change-Id: Ia3e8b7d8add933cd8a53f1c4e92dc3c4479009eb

commit_message:
Fix gating on tripleo-common-tempest-plugin

There are three changes here that need to be rolled into one patch, as
they are all needed to fix the gate.

- Correct the .gitreview project
- Resolve PEP8 Errors; Unused import and extra newlines.
- Fix the tox.ini to match the current tests. This can be expanded
  if/when different types of tests are added.

Change-Id: I335a527e41b865add7f306e3b494bf3d97829cb2

commit_message:
Update http deploy docs to be a bit more explicit

There have been some lessons learned on how to best deploy glance from
using uwsgi in the gate. This commit updates the docs a bit to explain
some pitfalls to avoid.

This also adds a glossary at th end of the docs to explain common terms.
There are several very similar terms with related meanings used in the doc
so to clear up confusing the glossary should be helpful.

Change-Id: I255d2049a5d519909c88101833ddd259328fcee7

commit_message:
Neutron agent delete: remove the wrong argument

The take_action() function was calling get_agent() with the wrong
attribute, causing agent deletion to fail. It turns out calling
get_agent() isn't necessary; this removes the call entirely and moves
the 'ignore_missing' argument to the delete_agent() function.

Change-Id: Iaa3754a3be0765112f396495fa5fb2e32e6eae4e
Closes-Bug: #1711301

commit_message:
DevStack: Install bridge-utils

The devstack run is currently failing due to the brutils command not
being installed, this patch fixes it.

ERROR: the main setup script run by this job failed - exit code: 2
please look at the relevant log files to determine the root cause
Running devstack worlddump.py
/bin/sh: 1: brctl: not found

Change-Id: I05af041691e433b08b139811f4fc13650bb72e45

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I99ae8fc8750ab69366e74596cac66c74d5b2be26
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: Ibb511466d8de0f4fc1bc158993fa2b674d6edb3b
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I6857ba8b568bc380304cab8a173420d804333128

commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I19d120c57d8f8d1a5e9ab2259587d1978ee8fbed

This is a straight copy of the original gate-{name}-requirements job,
except it copies the script over to the host rather than depending on a
baked-in copy of the script. Followups should rework it to stop using
zuul-cloner.

(jlk) updated to fix pep8 errors so that the patch can land.

Change-Id: I734db3b3e4d445e15084d1ca6e60cf2fe392385d

Fix check-requirements

Fix check-requirements: The assumptions with remote branch are not valid
anymore with Zuul v3, the change is on the proposed branch, check against
HEAD^1 instead.

Use the command module instead of script to get stdout in the
job-output.txt.gz file. Zuul v3 currently will not record the output from script
module in that file, only when command is used.

Note that the script module copied the file to the remote system - the
system where the tests are run - while command does not do this. But
the command is already on the remote system, use correct path for it.

Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: Ib44332b4daf63b9d3fca6eadf0b4825614ca4aeb

commit_message:
Add copy project-config's legacy-requirements-cross-* jobs

These are going to be rewritten to native zuulv3 jobs
in the next commit.

Needed-By: I3b0dbdcc02a0a8cff0c52701fadf7632648afb97
Change-Id: I3b9a86528350242c4d785d0f49c318de6c29ec75
Closes-Bug: #1730673

Add requirements-check job

This is a straight copy of the original gate-{name}-requirements job,
except it copies the script over to the host rather than depending on a
baked-in copy of the script. Followups should rework it to stop using
zuul-cloner.

(jlk) updated to fix pep8 errors so that the patch can land.

Change-Id: I734db3b3e4d445e15084d1ca6e60cf2fe392385d

Fix check-requirements

Fix check-requirements: The assumptions with remote branch are not valid
anymore with Zuul v3, the change is on the proposed branch, check against
HEAD^1 instead.

Use the command module instead of script to get stdout in the
job-output.txt.gz file. Zuul v3 currently will not record the output from script
module in that file, only when command is used.

Note that the script module copied the file to the remote system - the
system where the tests are run - while command does not do this. But
the command is already on the remote system, use correct path for it.

Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: Ib44332b4daf63b9d3fca6eadf0b4825614ca4aeb

commit_message:
Fix wrong permission on database during mysql_init tasks.

During mysql initialization, mysql needs to be able to write in the
database directory.

Change-Id: I82c2e46f66ab01021cb910eb7e0d17c81b00fa09
Closes-bug: #1730349

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs into tree

This patch moves the legacy ironic-python-agent CI jobs into the
tree instead of storing them in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs
to give us control as we migrate the legacy jobs to the new ansible
roles.

Change-Id: I7f98258589954639fa8187a3fec4a0b9da05915d
(cherry picked from commit e9c845553bcea3a8f1435037e3bb94bc37354f94)

commit_message:
move listener targets to notification agent

processing endpoints shouldn't dictate what targets are being listened
to. they should just process what it is given based on their filter.

move this logic to notification agent so every processing endpoint
isn't defining the same set of targets to listen to.

ensure duplicate targets aren't created

Change-Id: I9ffe28b6406dcef88ef6861eb8a81e1a3ad786d2

commit_message:
rename sample handler

process_notification and process_notifications are very similar.
renamed process_notification to build_sample so we don't accidentally
call wrong thing. also, it's a bit more descriptive.

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: I7db56d052012b107e1e63ab81e5d3bf6090f7d2f
(cherry picked from commit 2ce404b45313b308447fff4b7172e10cd6d6dfc4)

commit_message:
Tell HAProxy container template that the public cert was autogenerated

With the recent change to only mounting the certificate when it's used
[1]. The usecase of autogenerating the public certificate was missed.
This enables a flag to tell the template to mount it if we're
autogenerating the certificate.

[1] Id8ba09902d25689e642f922c43e71649977bf248

Change-Id: I299e6052e6a872c3907184b635d218a806d906e0

commit_message:
Fix gating on tripleo-common-tempest-plugin

There are three changes here that need to be rolled into one patch, as
they are all needed to fix the gate.

- Correct the .gitreview project
- Resolve PEP8 Errors; Unused import and extra newlines.
- Fix the tox.ini to match the current tests. This can be expanded
  if/when different types of tests are added.

Change-Id: I1710156229a8491f337757ec5f19a77ce6454f0c

subject: n8g-bagpipe: skip release note testing for stable/ocata
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 22:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'n8g-bagpipe: skip release note testing for stable/ocata

For historical reasons, n8g-bagpipe was using git subproject
until ocata (included), but this is not supported by reno (see
bug 1712069).

To allow merging fixes in stable/ocata, this change disables
the reno job for this branch.

Change-Id: I2626ebd5555ab50f9bfb4d541972a6fc87f433ed
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
n8g-bagpipe: skip release note testing for stable/ocata

For historical reasons, n8g-bagpipe was using git subproject
until ocata (included), but this is not supported by reno (see
bug 1712069).

To allow merging fixes in stable/ocata, this change disables
the reno job for this branch.

Change-Id: I2626ebd5555ab50f9bfb4d541972a6fc87f433ed

subject: Fix subnets can not be deleted from network topology panel
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-12 06:53:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/js/horizon.networktopology.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/views.py'], 'message': "Fix subnets can not be deleted from network topology panel

The structure of DetailView was changed, so the url for the delete
subnet action needs to be updated so that subnets can be deleted properly.

Added the required method get_subnets_data in DetailView.

Added JS code to remove the subnet from the network node on network
topology panel after the subnet is deleted.

Fixed router interface not being removed from the network topology
panel after it's deleted.

Closes-bug: #1643414

Change-Id: I60cc161655b994c8e3ace5efc37459f3e9e60d67
(cherry picked from commit fb4ae6bbda8f45429bf1c5f34a61292586847742)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix subnets can not be deleted from network topology panel

The structure of DetailView was changed, so the url for the delete
subnet action needs to be updated so that subnets can be deleted properly.

Added the required method get_subnets_data in DetailView.

Added JS code to remove the subnet from the network node on network
topology panel after the subnet is deleted.

Fixed router interface not being removed from the network topology
panel after it's deleted.

Closes-bug: #1643414

Change-Id: I60cc161655b994c8e3ace5efc37459f3e9e60d67
(cherry picked from commit fb4ae6bbda8f45429bf1c5f34a61292586847742)

commit_message:
Simplify get_acls() and update_acls_for_security_group()

This patch is removing the "*_cache" parameters from these methods and
their helper methods because it's not being used anywhere in the real
code.

The parameters were only being used in the unittests but we should use
mock instead.

Change-Id: Ib3e1a64b2b9e077d2a399272aa63856baf311820

[{'created': '2017-11-08 07:37:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install_and_upgrade/install.rst'], 'message': 'Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I25d24db87a61cd19b66a0d9493beabc73278ec68
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I25d24db87a61cd19b66a0d9493beabc73278ec68

commit_message:
v2 plugin: Relax the validation for binding:profile

It can have other fields like "migrating_to".

Note: This code doesn't exist in pike and later.

Closes-Bug: #1718177
Change-Id: If126b1c612761044e42512336ee87f8238f6d8db

commit_message:
Use ansible to deploy undercloud.

This sets up the "openstack undercloud deploy" to download ansible playbooks
and execute them to create a containerized undercloud deployment.

Change-Id: I1089536f7ee4adc048f33ced5b3ae0d4b8aac0d5

commit_message:
Don't install packages as part of undercloud deploy.

This should be done on the host as part of the setup.

Change-Id: I2297fb4ea0b24c01900a0af5f26b1ec5a5816a8b

subject: Refactor undercloud deploy.
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-27 22:47:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor undercloud deploy.

This patch refactors undercloud deploy:
- Cleans up the ordering so that you can plainly see what is happening.
- Calls ansible directly with exec() instead of fork/exec.
- Cleans up error handling to be very clear in the case of any errors
  from the script or from heat.
- Kills heat silently and reliably.

Change-Id: I2acce8a01be3f5225f5a8e89f501427761c412ab
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-27 22:58:45.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Refactor undercloud deploy.

This patch refactors undercloud deploy:
- Cleans up the ordering so that you can plainly see what is happening.
- Calls ansible directly with exec() instead of fork/exec.
- Cleans up error handling to be very clear in the case of any errors
  from the script or from heat.
- Kills heat silently and reliably.

Change-Id: I2acce8a01be3f5225f5a8e89f501427761c412ab
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Refactor undercloud deploy.

This patch refactors undercloud deploy:
- Cleans up the ordering so that you can plainly see what is happening.
- Calls ansible directly with exec() instead of fork/exec.
- Cleans up error handling to be very clear in the case of any errors
  from the script or from heat.
- Kills heat silently and reliably.

Change-Id: I2acce8a01be3f5225f5a8e89f501427761c412ab

commit_message:
Fix CentOS 7 fluentd image

Use specific gem version for the plugins:
 - fluent-plugin-rewrite-tag-filter
 - fluent-plugin-elasticsearch

Change-Id: Icc5b8972e7eca01767cdc9321ee82d1fcde187d8
Closes-Bug: 1730346
(cherry picked from commit f4731f7a6da5031b8acc2c260427a3ee376cc3b3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-29 12:01:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Support security groups association per port

This patch support operation for operators and project users to
associate security groups to a port. The feature is mentioned at
last summit[1].
This function UI is same as the function of security groups
association per instance. To realize this, the way of implementation
for 'Edit port' is changed, which move from a single modal to a
workflow base.

[1]It comes from the neutron user feedback session in Barcelona.
   https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ocata-neutron-end-user-operator-feedback (L.35+)

Also we need to display how security groups is associated at a port.
At the moment, there is not way to be able to see it (only this function).
It should be done as an another patch.

Change-Id: I96e0fafdffbf05b8167ec1b85f7430176fdaab90
Closes-Bug: #1637444

commit_message:
Support security groups association per port

This patch support operation for operators and project users to
associate security groups to a port. The feature is mentioned at
the neutron user feedback session in Barcelona summit [1].

This function UI is same as the function of security groups
association per instance. To realize this, the way of implementation
for 'Edit port' is changed, which move from a single modal to a
workflow base.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ocata-neutron-end-user-operator-feedback (L.35+)

Also we need to display how security groups is associated at a port.
At the moment, there is not way to be able to see it (only this function).
It should be done as an another patch.

Change-Id: I96e0fafdffbf05b8167ec1b85f7430176fdaab90
Closes-Bug: #1637444
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

Update networking-sfc grafana dashboard

Use new locations for stats after zuulv3 migration
Move multinode tempest check to correct (check queue) graph

commit_message:
Rolling upgrades related dev documentation

Adds a new 'Rolling Upgrades' developer document that describes the
design (from the associated spec) and includes notes on what to do
when developing a new feature or modifying an IronicObject.

Replaces the rolling upgrades information in the code contribution
guide, with a link to this new Rolling Upgrades page.

Change-Id: I5cc0b42da6e9e66f5c607bddbb3a2232cda97c6f
Closes-Bug: #1526283

commit_message:
Simplify network_args

When network isolation is disabled, network_args already default to
being empty. For network isolation enabled are two variants of the
network_args fact setting: without containers, with containers. Any
sub-variants like TLS can hopefully fit in as if/else blocks into
these, so that we don't have to start drawing Venn diagrams for
combinations of `when` clause conditions :)

Also this commit removes containers-default-parameters.yaml from
network args. This should be provided via container_args, and nowadays
it's just for setting images and insecure registry params, so we
shouldn't need to put it again into network_args.

Change-Id: I08921c18dd660356eed64d4e1e1028ba485e5942

commit_message:
Only mount selinux sysfs in nova_libvirt container

https://review.openstack.org/500952 initially just did this. Then we assumed
every container should have the selinux sysfs.
This causes issues with the sshd container used for live-migration.

The advice from the selinux experts is that it should not be enabled within
containers, so reverting back to the original fix that enables it only in the
nova-libvirt container.

Closes-bug: 1729405
Change-Id: I80bf38d7d64ab99510574af5c57423fde9b84eca

When SELinux is enforcing, use the docker volume mount flag
:z for the docker-puppet tool's bind-mounted volumes in RW mode.
Note, if a volume mount with a Z, then the label will be specific
to the container, and not be able to be shared between containers.

", 'number': 10}, {'created': '2017-11-03 15:55:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow containerized undercloud deploy with SELinux

When SELinux is enforcing, use the docker volume mount flag
:z for the docker-puppet tool's bind-mounted volumes in RW mode.
Note, if a volume mount with a Z, then the label will be specific
to the container, and not be able to be shared between containers.

Volumes from /etc/pki mounted RO do not require the context changes.
For those RO volumes that do require it, simulate :z with the
chcon command, effectively allowing :ro:z for volumes, which docker
does not support directly.

For deploy-steps, make sure ansible file resources in /var/lib/
created with the same SELinux context attributes what chcon uses.

Partial-bug: #1682179
Related-bug: #1723003

commit_message:
Allow containerized undercloud deploy with SELinux

When SELinux is enforcing, use the docker volume mount flag
:z for the docker-puppet tool's bind-mounted volumes in RW mode.
Note, if a volume mount with a Z, then the label will be specific
to the container, and not be able to be shared between containers.

Volumes from /etc/pki mounted RO do not require the context changes.
For those RO volumes that do require it, use :ro,z.

For deploy-steps, make sure ansible file resources in /var/lib/
are enforced the same SELinux context attributes what docker's :z
provides.

Partial-bug: #1682179
Related-bug: #1723003

Change-Id: Idc0caa49573bd88e8410d3d4217fd39e9aabf8f2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight.yaml \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight-sriov.yaml

commit_message:
Env files for ODL deployments

This patch adds env files for SRIOV, OVS-DPDK, L2GW, BGPVPN
and SFC deployments with ODL.

These files contain configs not present in basic ODL deployment
env file. While deploying, these need to be used along the basic
deployment env file like

openstack overcloud deploy \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight.yaml \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight-dpdk.yaml

and

openstack overcloud deploy \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight.yaml \
 -e environments/services-docker/neutron-opendaylight-sriov.yaml

and so forth for all other deployments.

Closes-Bug: 1722881

Change-Id: I2b70d3f4518e0c014cf37f7fecd92f69989f0860

commit_message:
Add missing puppet configuration to undercloud deploy

For containerized underclouds, the docker-puppet tool expects
symlinks created for puppet modules by specific paths.
Ensure the client creates those instead of relying on multiple
external places, like quickstart or cuztom bash scripts or docs.

Related-bug: #1723003
Closes-bug: #1725329

Change-Id: I60255386051b80c2fcacb4770e079fd450074c53
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2058019c2f81e64fbac62ab04b7475037a723755)

commit_message:
Add containerized barbican environment

This environment enables the barbican API environment, and in the
future, it'll enable workers and the keystone notifier as well.

Change-Id: Ic7cf086a5f1d55c8faf703a5a3b96f7f9ab805f7
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace default gnocchi endpoint type

The default gnocchi endpoint type is publicURL in gnocchiclient.
This patch replaces default gnocchi endpoint type from
internalURL to publicURL
see https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/adapter.py#L347-L351

Change-Id: I00eb08e4a20dc5da6ca2fa2ea4bef4a3175c26a8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 7109, 'name': 'Dmitry Mescheryakov (dmitryme)', 'email': 'dmescheryakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmitryme'}, {'_account_id': 8601, 'name': 'Dmitriy Ukhlov', 'email': 'dukhlov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dukhlov'}, {'_account_id': 9257, 'name': 'John Eckersberg', 'email': 'jeckersb@redhat.com', 'username': 'jeckersb'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}, {'_account_id': 18805, 'name': 'Alexey Lebedev', 'email': 'alebedev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'binarin'}, {'_account_id': 26159, 'name': 'xiexianbin', 'email': 'xiexianbin@yovole.com', 'username': 'xianbin'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-10 22:12:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'rabbit: Add rabbit_queue_ttl option

This causes queues to be declared with the x-expires argument,
defaulting to 300 seconds.  When a queue is unused (no consumers and
not re-declared) for the duration of the TTL, the broker will
automatically delete the queue.

This is an important complement to auto_delete queues, and it is
recommended to always have a queue TTL set.  Queues marked auto_delete
are only deleted if a consumer existed at some point, and then
disconnected, resulting in zero consumers.

Consider the following scenario: a client declares a queue
(auto_delete) and binds it to a fanout exchange, but before the client
can consume from the queue, it dies.

Because there was never (and will never be) a consumer of this queue,
the auto_delete logic does not fire.  The queue will live forever, and
will collect a copy of every message that is sent to the bound fanout
exchange.  Given enough published messages to the exchange, the queue
will eventually consume all available memory on the broker.

This is bad and we should avoid it by setting a reasonable TTL.

Change-Id: I83a8d09dc0cdae24c12d7043ec810529a9ce57ab

will collect a copy of every message that is sent to the bound fanout

will eventually consume all available memory on the broker.

This is bad and we should avoid it by setting a reasonable TTL.

Change-Id: I83a8d09dc0cdae24c12d7043ec810529a9ce57ab

Consider the following scenario: a client declares a queue
(auto_delete) and binds it to a fanout exchange, but before the client

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-11-20 22:29:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'rabbit: Add rabbit_queue_ttl option

Setting this causes queues to be declared with the x-expires argument.
When a queue is unused (no consumers and not re-declared) for the
duration of the TTL, the broker will automatically delete the queue.

This is a helpful safeguard to prevent queues with zero consumers from
growing without bound.

Closes-bug: #1515278
Change-Id: I83a8d09dc0cdae24c12d7043ec810529a9ce57ab
', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2016-01-13 15:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Kombu: make reply and fanout queues expire instead of auto-delete

Right now fanout and reply queues are unconditionally created with
auto-delete flag which causes a number of problems listed in bug
1495568. Replacing auto-delete with queue expiration with some sane
timeout should fix all these issues at once.

Another problem being fixed is that auto-delete flag does not causes
the queue to be deleted if it never had consumers. An orphaned fanout
queue might appear that way and it will grow indefinitely until
somebody manually removes it. See bug 1515278 for details.

A new rabbit_transient_queues_ttl config parameter is introduced which
configures the TTL for reply and fanout queues. It is a positive
integer representing timeout in seconds. By default it is set to 10
minutes. That should be enough for application to reconnect or
for server to send reply to client which already died. At the same
time, it seems that not so many messages could be accumulated in
fanout queues during that time.

DocImpact
With this change RabbitMQ driver defines reply and fanout queues
differently comparing with the previous release: now they are defined
with queue TTL (https://www.rabbitmq.com/ttl.html#queue-ttl) instead
of auto-delete flag. That helps avoid a number of issues, see commit
description for details. A new rabbit_transient_queues_ttl parameter
is defined which controls the TTL value. It is set to 10 minutes by
default. The change does not affect upgrade in any way.

Closes-bug: #1495568
Closes-bug: #1515278

Co-Authored-by: Dmitry Mescheryakov <dmescheryakov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I83a8d09dc0cdae24c12d7043ec810529a9ce57ab
', 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
Kombu: make reply and fanout queues expire instead of auto-delete

Right now fanout and reply queues are unconditionally created with
auto-delete flag which causes a number of problems listed in bug
1495568. Replacing auto-delete with queue expiration with some sane
timeout should fix all these issues at once.

Another problem being fixed is that auto-delete flag does not causes
the queue to be deleted if it never had consumers. An orphaned fanout
queue might appear that way and it will grow indefinitely until
somebody manually removes it. See bug 1515278 for details.

A new rabbit_transient_queues_ttl config parameter is introduced which
configures the TTL for reply and fanout queues. It is a positive
integer representing timeout in seconds. By default it is set to 10
minutes. That should be enough for application to reconnect or
for server to send reply to client which already died. At the same
time, it seems that not so many messages could be accumulated in
fanout queues during that time.

DocImpact
With this change RabbitMQ driver defines reply and fanout queues
differently comparing with the previous release: now they are defined
with queue TTL (https://www.rabbitmq.com/ttl.html#queue-ttl) instead
of auto-delete flag. That helps avoid a number of issues, see commit
description for details. A new rabbit_transient_queues_ttl parameter
is defined which controls the TTL value. It is set to 10 minutes by
default. The change does not affect upgrade in any way.

Closes-bug: #1495568
Closes-bug: #1515278

Co-Authored-by: Dmitry Mescheryakov <dmescheryakov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I83a8d09dc0cdae24c12d7043ec810529a9ce57ab

commit_message:
Fix iscsi and tgt containers deployment case

In the following config:
enable_cinder=False
enable_cinder_backend_iscsi=True

Iscsi and tgt containers are deployed but should not.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I1d66627b9979b5dc570bbc3e1e865311dd7e7bb0
Closes-Bug: #1715618

commit_message:
libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks
to see if the instance base directory (which contains the domain xml
files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a
volume-backed instance and if the instance base directory is on shared
storage, e.g. NFS or Ceph, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

This adds a check to see if the instance is volume-backed when checking
to see if the instance base directory should be removed from the source
host when confirming a resize.

Change-Id: I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a
Closes-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit f02afc6569bd930114a4b56413dbd6becc5e7e75)
(cherry picked from commit d5d81a29050966f47050f0f77001273b1aa55116)

commit_message:
libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks
to see if the instance base directory (which contains the domain xml
files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a
volume-backed instance and if the instance base directory is on shared
storage, e.g. NFS or Ceph, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

This adds a check to see if the instance is volume-backed when checking
to see if the instance base directory should be removed from the source
host when confirming a resize.

commit_message:
Fix return type in FilterScheduler._legacy_find_hosts

The FilterScheduler._schedule method should be returning
a list of list of selected hosts. When include_alternatives
is False in _legacy_find_hosts, it was only returning back
a list of hosts, which would result in an IndexError when
select_destinations() tries to take the first entry from each
item in the list.

Change-Id: Ia6c87900605d3604beb74b942b0e30575b814112
Closes-Bug: #1729445

commit_message:
zuul.d/projects.yaml: Sort the job list

Sort the job list to make it easier to compare the 'check' jobs and
the 'gate' jobs.

Put the non-voting jobs in their own section.

Remove the 'voting: false' part from the experimental jobs as it is
unneeded.  Experimental jobs do not have any voting powers. So it is
redundant to mark them as 'voting: false'

Change-Id: I6ad8797c6973e04ec6835cfbab7b74eb0bd85220

The Qos extension's API definition was rehomed into neutron-lib with

consume it with I3bb987920008d5a1d73cf4c5f37895d7f917c368

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
use qos api def from neutron-lib

The Qos extension's API definition was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit I8ab3712850ec02278b3efb9161fc03236926b842 and neutron will
consume it with I3bb987920008d5a1d73cf4c5f37895d7f917c368

This patch removes the global attribute map update for the qos
extension in the Unit Tests. This isn't needed and is already handled in
extension loading.

Change-Id: Ibf957616cb1acacf2a61c138d354be9ccdf640b5

commit_message:
Add code for catch OVSFWPortNotFound exception.

This patch catch the OVSFWPortNotFound exception which raised by
get_ovs_port() function when ovs port not found.

Closes-Bug: #1730552

Change-Id: I6a5774fe8ffb167381282b855f0935f4b413432e

commit_message:
Switch undercloud-containers to use oooq/fs027

Stop using logic in tripleo-ci and start using the featureset in
tripleo-quickstart in the gate.
It's an iteration toward using tripleo-quickstart in the gate for
undercloud-containers job, and move forward with having scenarios using
this role.

Change-Id: Ie4c84ee9ae56c223915ea3bb4bcad74c38a69f1f

subject: Do deep redirects from old docs.openstack.org URLs
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 20:25:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/source/_extra/.htaccess'], 'message': 'Do deep redirects from old docs.openstack.org URLs

The docs.openstack.org site was rearranged so that the old docs at
/developer/heat/ are now at /heat/latest/. The base .htaccess file in
openstack-manuals redirects everything in the old hierarchy to the root
of the new one unless there is a .htaccess file present (see
I0af0e32d9c646d61f4c72599cdc4613299aa5ec9).

Add a .htaccess file so that old links redirect to the equivalent page
in the new location.

Change-Id: I74de09f4e25c2eda050053d3b8646586c9f24c04
Closes-Bug: #1722820
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do deep redirects from old docs.openstack.org URLs

The docs.openstack.org site was rearranged so that the old docs at
/developer/heat/ are now at /heat/latest/. The base .htaccess file in
openstack-manuals redirects everything in the old hierarchy to the root
of the new one unless there is a .htaccess file present (see
I0af0e32d9c646d61f4c72599cdc4613299aa5ec9).

Add a .htaccess file so that old links redirect to the equivalent page
in the new location.

Change-Id: I74de09f4e25c2eda050053d3b8646586c9f24c04
Closes-Bug: #1722820

commit_message:
Tripleoclient unified queue name.

This will allow the cli and tripleo UI to share a common queue,
which will help with scripting the frontend behaviour or track
the progress of the cli from the frontend.

Related-Bug: #1603345

Change-Id: I5849983eee82b5a56cae1bf38a3c2694b6b291db

commit_message:
Enable Cinder as a backend for Glance

Enable Cinder as a backend for Glance by adding 'cinder' to the list of
allowed choices for the GlanceBackend heat parameter.

Update the glance-api docker configuration to allow the feature to work.
This is necessary because the feature uses iSCSI, which requires additional
privileges.

Closes-Bug: #1728409
Depends-On: I850047e32f3608b3ce490e52e2e540695cb1a4ff
Change-Id: I42241747de931103a04aa5ee2ed18fd46197d183
(cherry picked from commit e828e8c7bb2e890b243faa767992226dc270bb6f)

subject: Refactor undercloud deploy to use Ansible.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-27 23:17:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor undercloud deploy to use Ansible.

This patch refactors undercloud deploy:
- Cleans up the ordering so that you can plainly see what is happening.
- Calls heat to resolve the stack without actually doing anything.
- Downloads Ansible from resolved heat stack.
- Calls ansible directly with exec().
- Cleans up error handling to be very clear in the case of any errors
  from the script or from heat.
- Kills heat silently and reliably.
- Removes fake keystone.
- Removes any yum updates.

Depends-On: I03f1789957ba157871fd13164592116d7fcdabe4
Depends-On: I5413ae4eadd5affdd1ae01678b61eafbe50b7919
Change-Id: I9fce6477566b439ceb2b5dc25eae307af9c9cc2b

- Downloads Ansible from resolved heat stack.
- Calls ansible directly with exec().
- Cleans up error handling to be very clear in the case of any errors

- Kills heat silently and reliably.
- Removes fake keystone.
- Removes any yum updates.

commit_message:
Refactor undercloud deploy to use Ansible.

This patch refactors undercloud deploy:
- Cleans up the ordering so that you can plainly see what is happening.
- Calls heat to resolve the stack without actually doing anything.
- Downloads Ansible from resolved heat stack.
- Calls ansible directly with exec().
- Cleans up error handling to be very clear in the case of any errors
  from the script or from heat.
- Kills heat silently and reliably.
- Removes fake keystone.
- Removes any yum updates.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Depends-On: I03f1789957ba157871fd13164592116d7fcdabe4
Depends-On: I5413ae4eadd5affdd1ae01678b61eafbe50b7919
Change-Id: I9fce6477566b439ceb2b5dc25eae307af9c9cc2b

commit_message:
Add tags to baremetal cron removal tasks

In 59e29b17f4a9f5f65b6f8a7b8e82ef6426d8a51 we forgot to
add tags to the Ansible tasks to remove the baremetal
cron jobs at step 2.

(cherry picked from commit 1128271b460b120a2a59eac3df95082c55e554d0)

Change-Id: I23fb134b88336ebc4eb1a97a69a2d73d4ef0edb2
Related-bug: #1708466

commit_message:
Load all templates for generating parameter schema

To be able to handle parameter defaults properly, we need to load all
possible templates when merging the environments, to generate an
approximate schema.

Closes-Bug: #1669571
Change-Id: Idab781d3e6af92990c357a727aa60ec0aa8f5f05
(cherry picked from commit 7221cd2eba592cdb2097b3af52f9c297a54aae60)

commit_message:
Replace pycrypto with cryptography

Pycrypto is no longer maintained, and heat currently uses Pycrypto.
This patch rewrites functions using Pycrypto and replaces them with
cryptography functions.

See [1], [2] for reference.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568.html
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/617715/

Change-Id: I27e7208e19726c5325bad2874e43f5d841779008
Co-Authored-By: Omar Tleimat <otleimat@ucla.edu>

subject: Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 02:59:48.000000000', 'files': ['templates/ceph.conf'], 'message': 'Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`

Upstream Ceph removed the `osd crush location` option in
commit f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e [0]. This
causes new clusters deployed from the Pike UCA (Luminous)
using the customize-failure-domain option to not create or
move the OSD to the correct spot in the OSD tree. The end
result is that placement groups will fail to peer because
there are no racks to select hosts and OSDs from.

Instead, the charm should set the more generic `crush
location` option in the ceph.conf file. It is and has been
supported since the Firefly (trusty-icehouse) version of
Ceph.

[0] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e

Change-Id: I0b7055b20f54096a2f33583079326aee17726355
Closes-Bug: 1730839
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change `osd crush location` to `crush location`

Upstream Ceph removed the `osd crush location` option in
commit f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e [0]. This
causes new clusters deployed from the Pike UCA (Luminous)
using the customize-failure-domain option to not create or
move the OSD to the correct spot in the OSD tree. The end
result is that placement groups will fail to peer because
there are no racks to select hosts and OSDs from.

Instead, the charm should set the more generic `crush
location` option in the ceph.conf file. It is and has been
supported since the Firefly (trusty-icehouse) version of
Ceph.

[0] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/f9db479a14d9103a2b7c0a24d958fe5fff94100e

Change-Id: I0b7055b20f54096a2f33583079326aee17726355
Closes-Bug: 1730839

commit_message:
Miss node_id in devstack lib

When installing devstack, found there is
a missing node id in devstack/lib/ironic
when root devices are less than 4Gb.

Change-Id: I331bfe1e6481dc0de2869166fc6a2a0398314735
Closes-Bug: #1730526

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 06:08:29.000000000', 'files': ['glance/templates/service-api.yaml', 'barbican/values.yaml', 'heat/values.yaml', 'cinder/values.yaml', 'magnum/values.yaml', 'heat/templates/service-api.yaml', 'cinder/templates/service-api.yaml', 'glance/values.yaml', 'neutron/templates/service-server.yaml', 'horizon/values.yaml', 'glance/templates/service-registry.yaml', 'nova/templates/service-osapi.yaml', 'keystone/templates/service-api.yaml', 'magnum/templates/service-api.yaml', 'gnocchi/templates/service-api.yaml', 'nova/templates/service-metadata.yaml', 'gnocchi/values.yaml', 'nova/values.yaml', 'keystone/values.yaml', 'barbican/templates/service-api.yaml', 'neutron/values.yaml', 'horizon/templates/service.yaml'], 'message': 'Add option to set external policy to local for openstack services

External traffic policy "local" would be preffered when openstack
service is accessed from external via node port. This option has an
effect only when service node port is enabled.

commit_message:
Add option to set external policy to local for openstack services

External traffic policy "local" would be preffered when openstack
service is accessed from external via node port. This option has an
effect only when service node port is enabled.

Change-Id: Ic68cfc59dc39dc842d4790deffa70efe433dd7a6

commit_message:
refresh agent if group membership changes

this broke when we switched to tooz partitioner
- ensure we trigger refresh if group changes
- ensure we have heartbeat or else members will just die.

- remove retain_common_targets tests because it doesn't make sense.
it was originally designed for when we had listener per pipeline
but that was changed 726b2d4d67ada3df07f36ecfd81b0cf72881e159
- remove testing workload partitioning path in standard notification
agent tests
- correct test_unique test to properly validate a single target
rather than the number of listeners we have.
- add test to ensure group_state is updated when a member joins
- add test to verify that listener assigned topics based on hashring

Closes-Bug: #1729617
Change-Id: I5039c93e6845a148c24094f755a78870d49ec19f
(cherry picked from commit 75cc518c2f86afd02a7e60df150148c8a0f2e813)

commit_message:
Revert "devstack: Set an optimal processing queue"

This reverts commit f1bdf6751a503ee570ce114f9a31fdb2959a79d0.

this causes distribution to be either 50/50 or 100/0. in the latter
case, the single worker usually fails to process pipeline queues in a
timely manner

The horizon test script did not work when using curl. It went unnoticed

The optional arguments POST_ARG and REFERER_ARG were uninitialized
(an error with nounset) and passed as empty string arguments if set

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix test_horizon for curl

The horizon test script did not work when using curl. It went unnoticed
because we always use wget for testing.

The optional arguments POST_ARG and REFERER_ARG were uninitialized
(an error with nounset) and passed as empty string arguments if set
to an empty string.

This patch fixes the code path for curl.

Change-Id: I7baeb1b409d9bbd90eb57493f5428a7b9f404644

Messaging driver is extended to read profiling events
from RabbitMQ and generate report. This simplifies
usage of profiling in DevStack since Ceilometer is not
needed anymore.

The typical workflow is following:
1. User issues a command with profiling enabled:
   openstack --os-profile SECRET KEY <command>

2. User retrieves the trace:
   osprofiler trace show --connection messaging://
      --transport-url rabbit://<rabbituser>:<rabbitpassword>@<devstack>:5672/

commit_message:
Extend messaging driver to support reporting

Messaging driver is extended to read profiling events
from RabbitMQ and generate report. This simplifies
usage of profiling in DevStack since Ceilometer is not
needed anymore.

The typical workflow is following:
1. User issues a command with profiling enabled:
   openstack --os-profile SECRET KEY <command>

2. User retrieves the trace:
   osprofiler trace show --connection messaging://
      --transport-url rabbit://<rabbituser>:<rabbitpassword>@<devstack>:5672/
      --json <trace-id>

Change-Id: I950896d6d9156f09e378bdfcf272aef5da4ece74

set branches in grenade

there use to be some magic that selected the right
stable branches to test even though it clones master.
this is either gone or broken so it now pulls in master
and sticks with it.

this patch makes branches explicit

commit_message:
Do not run baremetal scenarios after Ocata

Pike is the release where we support containerized services, we don't
want to run baremetal scenarios anymore, so we save Infra resources.

We still have a few jobs running on baremetal, and they'll be cleanup
later but this iteration is just for the scenarios.

scenario001: only newton/ocata
scenario002: only newton/ocata
scenario003: only ocata
scenario004: only ocata

Change-Id: I7f1ef93a25bf8485facaec3f836df74ad218a719

commit_message:
check task_state in the live_migrate_instance

If server migration fails, the while loop will not break
until retry to 0,
we can check the task_state to avoid this situation.

Closes-Bug: #1728476
Change-Id: I07e1048eb736263a261456ee78c96fee9db13cb5

commit_message:
Update helm-toolkit sync mechanism across repos

This patch set adds in the mechanism to use zuul-cloner in the zuul-gate
to pull in openstack-helm's helm-toolkit.  This allows for CRD to work
as expected and the code can be centralized in the OS-H instead of three
repos: OS-H, OS-H-infra, and OS-H-addons.

Change-Id: Ia5558491b80413e86ce6f133aa50c565a1dc0374

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 16:34:59.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/driver.py'], 'message': 'Update l2pop calls to use context instead of session

With the introduction of OVO objects, most l2pop methods were updated to
use a context, and not a session:
Idf72866d36f27ad0aa9b7a0b53034d2db45cd56d

The OVS driver calls 2 of these methods, so update the related code to
pass the context along

Change-Id: I394f8a16a19bcd16d65a9fcfb985d6fb6217d093
Closes-Bug: #1730076
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update l2pop calls to use context instead of session

With the introduction of OVO objects, most l2pop methods were updated to
use a context, and not a session:
Idf72866d36f27ad0aa9b7a0b53034d2db45cd56d

The OVS driver calls 2 of these methods, so update the related code to
pass the context along

Change-Id: I394f8a16a19bcd16d65a9fcfb985d6fb6217d093
Closes-Bug: #1730076

[{'created': '2017-10-10 12:18:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update OpenStack Client syntax for graphs (doc)

The OSC syntax for specifying branching points in Service Graphs
is going to be different than initially designed. Instead of:

--port-chains pc1:pc2,pc3;pc2:pc4,pc5

Now it will look like:

--branching-point pc1:pc2,pc3 --branching-point pc2:pc4,pc5

Change-Id: Idcfdc0eacf373ed3961079edfdca948495c2ea1e
Partial-Bug: #1587486
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-11-03 16:35:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/ietf_sfc_encapsulation.rst'], 'message': 'Update OpenStack Client syntax for graphs (doc)

is going to be different than initially designed. Instead of:

--port-chains pc1:pc2,pc3;pc2:pc4,pc5

Now it will look like:

--branching-point pc1:pc2,pc3 --branching-point pc2:pc4,pc5

commit_message:
Update OpenStack Client syntax for graphs (doc)

The OSC syntax for specifying branching points in Service Graphs
is going to be different than initially designed. Instead of:

--port-chains pc1:pc2,pc3;pc2:pc4,pc5

Now it will look like:

--branching-point pc1:pc2,pc3 --branching-point pc2:pc4,pc5

Change-Id: Idcfdc0eacf373ed3961079edfdca948495c2ea1e
Partial-Bug: #1587486

commit_message:
Add retries to read-only db operations

To prevent possible failures because of operational errors
we should add retries and send additional requests to the
database.

This change will increase the overall stability of the system
and will avoid obscure errors from the database.

Change-Id: I9ddef565acabbbfaddcb96f6a850a21875e6dcd5
Closes-bug: #1730426

commit_message:
Fix typo in config options

Some drivers:transport:websocket options had dashes instead of
underscore which caused zaqar to ignore them.

Change-Id: I0a0d0ddf5704415745868d39d763df0e43a21a61
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Hervé <therve@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1727406
Closes-Bug: #1730179
(cherry picked from commit f68f5e92179c1f49726dca98796307ad3c8bb4fb)

revisions:

commit_message:
Support no_auth mode in mistral client

Now it is impossible to send requests without authentication.
This patch allows to disable it if user doesn't provide auth_url
to the client.

Change-Id: I3b964e349dd6843ceb022264abe451a1b407786b
Closes-bug: #1730067
(cherry picked from commit aa65b57816bd29e31355b8cecc9b20d10b0aa307)

commit_message:
Fixes InternalApi Heat network resource

Detection for using legacy network is now in tripleo-common so there is
no need to set it network_data.yaml anymore.

Depends-On: I695259ad87e2303f948875078bccb619786470e0

Closes-Bug: 1718764

Change-Id: I52468a687ba7215ec32c5700de346b3ed4ebd1f9
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix missing neutron net plugin options

They are missing from the sample config produced by
oslo-config-generator due to omissions in manila/opts.py.

Add them.

Closes-Bug: #1728463

commit_message:
Pass base service client config to get_credentials

The get_credentials helper in credentials_factory wraps
around auth.get_credentials but it fails to pass
the http_timeout. Fixing this by replacing the local dict
of configuration settings with config.get_service_config.

Change-Id: I3d6b54818f53c995c5d8359502bf9b8a80e797a1
Closes-bug: #1692484

commit_message:
Only set clients when service/api is available

The clients.py module initialises and set attributes for all clients
available in Tempest, regardless of whether the corresponding service
/ api version is configured as available.

This cleanup helps ensuring that tests use the expected version of
services, and prepares client.py to become a stable interface for
plugins.

A few bits of code rely on client aliases being defined, regardless of
configuration. Those issues are exposed by this patch, and fixed here.

Services that have multiple major versions are keystone, cinder and
glance. For keystone the API version is controlled via configuration,
already before this patch. Cinder has a _latest client setup in the
clients module and that concept is completed in this patch.
Glance is handled in the base class of relevant tests.

Depends-on: I21f07f7b3e8f22055e7978c0bf4aa01b80b493d9
Change-Id: I8410297f7e80871e74aa64e6907ebbb9e0bba79f
